sentence.text: We previously reported that seeds of Artocarpus integrifolia (jackfruit) contain a lectin, which we call jacalin, that is both a potent T cell mitogen and an apparently T cell-independent activator of human B cells for the secretion of immunoglobulins.
In this paper, we show that the precipitate is formed after the interaction of jacalin and the serum protein added to the culture medium.
In secretions such as colostrum, IgA is the only protein precipitated by jacalin.
Jacalin is a D-Gal binding lectin and should be a useful tool for studying of serum and secretory IgA.
